reference.unstructured: AEC Treaty, Art 6(2) states that an African Central Bank and the SINGLE Currency would be achieved in six stages.

WAMU Treaty Art 22 provided for the promulgation of this law.

The banking supervisory function of the BCEAO can be found in the following articles of the BCEAO Statute: Art 23 (granting assistance WAMU banks), Art 24 (request information such as those on the financial affairs of banks); Art 25 (requesting banks to report cases of payment problems); Art 27 (ensuring that harmonised banking laws are applied by domestic banks) and Art 28 (proposing the need to constitute reserve requirements deposits with itself, observe ratios within various components of their resources and observe ceilings for the amount of some of their uses of resources). Likewise the banking supervisory functions of the WAMU Banking Commission can be found in the WAMU Banking Commission Convention and its annex. WAMU Banking Commission Convention Art 1(1) outlines that the function of the WAMU Banking Commission is oversight of the organisation and supervision of banks and financial institutions; Art 1(2) states that the Banking Commission would be governed by the terms of the Annex to the Treaty; Art 12 is on the approval of banks and financial institution; Arts 13–21 are on supervision of banks and financial institution; Art 22 is on administrative measures; Art 23 is on disciplinary measures; Arts 13, 14 and 21 are on joint supervisory functions with the BCEAO.
WAMU Banking Convention Art 31 and the WAMU Banking Law Art 12 require authorisation from the ministry of finance of Member States for the licensing and closure of banks.

Ibid, 16.
The ANDEAN Community is a customs union comprising the South American countries of Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador and Peru; in Spanish it is known as Comunidad Andina (CAN).

MERCOSUR which is the short form for Mercado Común del Sur in Spanish and translated into English as the Southern Common Market, is an economic and political agreement among Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay, Uruguay and Venezuela. It was established in 1991 by the Treaty of Asuncion, which was revised in 1994 by the Treaty of Ouro Preto.

ASEAN, was established in Bangkok, Thailand on 8 August 1967, with the signing of the ASEAN Declaration. It is a regional economic organisation with economic integration as one of its main objectives. It has 10 members: Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. ASEAN Plus Three (APT) is a forum that functions as a co-ordinator of co-operation between the ASEAN nations and the three East Asian nations of China, Japan and South Korea. Government leaders, ministers, and senior offi cials from the 10 members of the ASEAN and the three Northeast Asian states consult on an increasing range of issues such as fi nancial cooperation and trade integration.

The GCC is a political and economic union of the Arab states bordering the Persian Gulf and located on or near the Arabian Peninsula. It has six members: Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates.

The AMU is a trade agreement with the aim also to achieve an economic and political unity among its member Arab countries of the Maghreb in North Africa, ie Algeria, Libya, Mauritania, Morocco and Tunisia.
Basel Committee on Banking Supervision, supra n 9.
For more on this see Salami, supra n 13.
